<!-- It contains information about your site's posts, pages, comments, categories, and other content. -->
<!-- You may use this file to transfer that content from one site to another. -->
<!-- This file is not intended to serve as a complete backup of your site. -->

<!-- To import this information into a WordPress site follow these steps: -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that site as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the WordPress admin panel. -->
<!-- 3. Install the "WordPress" importer from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Activate & Run Importer. -->
<!-- 5. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 6. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the site. For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the site or to create a new user. -->
<!-- 7. WordPress will then import each of the posts, pages, comments, categories, etc. -->
<!--    contained in this file into your site. -->

	<item>
		<title>Jr. iOS Developer</title>
		<link>https://blog.stationlocal.com/job/station-san-diego-130-jr-ios-developer/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Aug 2015 18:42:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blog.stationlocal.com/index.php/job/station-san-diego-130-web-developer/</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong>
<ul>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Develop and enhance mobile applications supporting our social broadcasting platform powered by local discovery using iOS Development.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Work with production support teams to develop and ensure real-time availability of mobile application.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Work closely with our other teams and our backend team to help bring beautiful, usable, and fast mobile designs to life.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Maintain and update a commercial iOS social media app, making minor changes for multiple clients, applying patches and submitting client-specific versions to iTunes Connect.   </span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Responsible for coding a Mac app and/or scripts to aid in managing the client-specific versions of the app.  </span></li>
</ul>
<span style="font-weight: 400;"><strong>Requirements:</strong>  </span>
<ul>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">At least 1 year experience writing objective C programs for iOS.  </span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience in C or other languages is a plus as is Mac or Linux terminal experience and familiarity with git.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Applicant should be able to show us one or more apps that he/she has created, whether or not they have been submitted to iTunes.</span></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Back End Developer</title>
		<link>https://blog.stationlocal.com/job/back-end-developer/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Sep 2015 17:45:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blog.stationlocal.com/?post_type=job_listing&#038;p=15830</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<b>What you will be doing</b>
<ul>
	<li>Work on a Go(lang) code base written in a micro services architecture using JSON distributed across multiple data centers.</li>
	<li>Use CoreOS/Docker on Google's Cloud to deliver 200ms-300ms response times.</li>
	<li>Use PostgreSQL &amp; AeroSpike databases to power our backend data storage and Google Buckets for asset storage.</li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements</b>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with Go(lang) is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Solid experience Micro Service Architecture</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Have solid experience building scalable web applications using open source technology</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">View programming as "your craft" and have strong opinions on the subject</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Want to gain further experience scaling a high traffic website to millions of requests/day</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Excited about achieving the quickest response times possible</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience w/ Agile Methods &amp; Scrum Meetings is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with Redis is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with Vagrant is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with CoreOS/Docker is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with AeroSpike is nice to have</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with PostgreSQL/SQL is a must</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Knowledgeable in HTTP/DNS protocols</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Strong understanding of web standards-based HTML(5) / CSS(3) / AJAX coding.</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Confident in a Linux environment using bash and vi/emacs</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Use a design pattern when you can and write reusable code </span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Use Distributed Version Control (Github)</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Familiar with functional programming languages</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Live in the cloud</span></li>
</ul>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Graphic Designer</title>
		<link>https://blog.stationlocal.com/job/graphic-designer/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Sep 2015 17:46:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blog.stationlocal.com/?post_type=job_listing&#038;p=15831</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>What you will be doing</strong>
<ul>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Work closely with internal development and design teams to ensure flawless integration with back-end technology and a great user experience</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Write front-end code (including HTML, CSS and JavaScript) using current standards for cross-platform and cross-browser compatibility</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Expert knowledge of user experience best practices and ability to implement solutions based on unique needs of specific users</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Navigate online products from 'test' mode to 'live' activation</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Create mock-ups, prototypes and wireframes with visual layout tools such as Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop</span></li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements</b>
<ul>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">2+ years Graphic Design &amp; UI/UX experience</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">EXPERT at Sketch a must!</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">EXPERT at inVision a must!</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Expert Knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Expert HTML5 and CSS skills</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Responsive Web Design Experience</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience working with non-destructive design techniques (i.e. smart objects)</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Flexibility in adapting to rapidly changing requirements</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Ability to work independently but also able to communicate cross-functionally to seek out information when required</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">Strong verbal and written communication skills, as well as excellent technical, analytical, debugging and problem-solving skills</span></li>
	<li><span style="font-weight: 400;">BS in Graphic Design, or equivalent combination of education and work experience</span></li>
</ul>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	</item>
	<item>
		<title>Sr. iOS Developer</title>
		<link>https://blog.stationlocal.com/job/sr-ios-developer/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Sep 2015 22:10:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[]]></dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">https://blog.stationlocal.com/?post_type=job_listing&#038;p=15841</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong>
<ul>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Develop and enhance mobile applications supporting our social broadcasting platform using iOS Development.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Work closely with other teams and our backend team to help bring beautiful, usable, and fast mobile designs to life.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Will be a strong member of a small team of iOS developers, creating a new, expanded version of a complex social media app.  </span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Expertise coding objective C using xCode, implementing detailed UI designs and working with other developers.  </span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">App will use AFNetworking,  core data,  multiple storyboards, images, audio, video and the Google Map api.</span></li>
</ul>
<strong>Requirements</strong>
<ul>
	<li>At least 2-3+ years experience writing objective C programs for iOS.</li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Familiarity with networking requests,  multiple objective c frameworks and in general, excellent competence in using xCode to create a variety of apps.  </span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Qualified candidates will have successfully submitted at least one app to iTunes and done significant coding on others.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience  in c, Swift or other languages.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Experience with git and github or similar repository.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Mac or Linux terminal experience is a plus as is experience using Mapping apis.</span></li>
	<li style="font-weight: 400;"><span style="font-weight: 400;">Degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.</span></li>
</ul>
&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
